instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't stay on battery but charges
threads.message:
Hi,

I've got that board which had a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
One cap near the CPU was shorted. Found, replaced and it looked like everything was fine.

However I now have another issue... the battery is recognized and apparently charging but it doesn't stay on battery.

<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> is 8.6V with the charger plugged but 1.4V when charger unplugged even after hours.
Battery is shown as being charged to 80% but still, 1.4V is getting out through <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>

Any thoughts please?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't stay on battery but charges
threads.message:
I assume you have tried a new battery?
Just because the data lines are working on the battery it does not mean that the chip will allow the battery to send out power or that the fuses have not blown.

Page 10

[URL="https://media.blackhat.com/bh-us-11/Miller/BH_US_11_Miller_Battery_Firmware_Public_WP.pdf"]https://media.blackhat.com/bh-us-11/..._Public_WP.pdf[/URL]

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't stay on battery but charges
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't stay on battery but charges
threads.message:
You nailed it!

I didn't the right battery type at the time so I couldn't check.

With a new battery it is working. So the short went pretty deep or it came from the battery who knows...
